entry.content:
Recently, I changed the comment serves from Duoshuo to Disqus on my blog and interested in adding a widget to show the recent comments in the sidebar. Back in the early days, Disqus itself provided an official JavaScript widget but, although itâ€™s still available, itâ€™s officially deprecated. And now you can use the Disqus API to get the raw data, and tailor the raw data exactly to your needs.

Disqus has a pretty complex API, and provides a recent comments sample written in php. But oddly, I wasnâ€™t able to find many examples of javascript for the API that suitable for a static site like mine.

Disqus widget js

In the old way, you can simply using this code to pull the recent comments1:

Just replace the example to your shortname on Disqus. And detailed configurations can find in this post: How To Add Disqus Recent Comments Widget.

Javascript widget based on Disqus API

The above method works, but itâ€™s not recommended by Disqus. So, letâ€™s move on to the Disqus API.

To start, you need to create an Application that offers you a public Disqus API key. You wonâ€™t need the API secret for the widget, only the API key, which can be publicly exposed on the client side. Remember to review the application settings, youâ€™ll want to enter the domains from where youâ€™ll allow this API key to be used.2

While there are a number of different APIs provided by Disqus, the forums/listPosts API is enough for this case. Disqus considers a site as a forum and posts are your comments. Make note of the various arguments you can pass to this API. For this example, two were important. First, I wanted a smaller number of results so I used limit=3. Secondly, the default results do not provide a way to get back to the original URL where the comment may be seen. Use related=thread to get thread data (and again, for a simple site one thread is one page) which will include the URL.3 Thatâ€™s it. Then you need to style the raw data by css that fit your site.

Here, for my blog site, I used the below lines to pull the recent comments:

Notice that you should change the forum=flinhong to you shortname, and replace the api_key of yours. More arguments can be found in Disqusâ€™s API documents.

Whatâ€™s more, since the return date is formatted as 2008-06-10T01:45:27, I used the moment js here to format the date like 20 minutes ago as Disqus does in its comments form. You can preview the output right in the sidebar of this post, in the Popular tabâ€¦

API usage limits

Disqus imposes a limit of 1000 requests per hour to their API, which can be an important limitation for a site with high traffic. If thatâ€™s your case, you should consider caching the results of the API requests so you reduce them. One attempt can be using jquery-ajax-localstorage so you can cache the requests on the client side. This way, if a visitor of your site sees the widget 10 times, only 1 request will be done and the rest will be cached.2
